013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArrayUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
020import java.lang.annotation.*;
021import java.lang.reflect.*;
022import java.net.*;
023import java.net.URI;
024import java.util.*;
025import java.util.function.*;
026
027import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.swaps.*;
037
038/**
039 * Contains metadata about a bean property.
040 *
041 * <p>
042 * Contains information such as type of property (e.g. field/getter/setter), class type of property value, and whether
043 * any transforms are associated with this property.
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * Developers will typically not need access to this class.  The information provided by it is already exposed through
047 * several methods on the {@link BeanMap} API.
048 *
049 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
050
051 * </ul>
052 */
053@SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
054public class BeanPropertyMeta implements Comparable<BeanPropertyMeta> {
055
056   final BeanMeta<?> beanMeta;                               // The bean that this property belongs to.
057   private final BeanContext beanContext;                    // The context that created this meta.
058
059   private final String name;                                // The name of the property.
060   private final Field field;                                // The bean property field (if it has one).
061   private final Field innerField;                                // The bean property field (if it has one).
062   private final Method getter, setter, extraKeys;           // The bean property getter and setter.
063   private final boolean isUri;                              // True if this is a URL/URI or annotated with @URI.
064   private final boolean isDyna, isDynaGetterMap;            // This is a dyna property (i.e. name="*")
065
066   private final ClassMeta<?>
067      rawTypeMeta,                                           // The real class type of the bean property.
068      typeMeta;                                              // The transformed class type of the bean property.
069
070   private final String[] properties;                        // The value of the @Beanp(properties) annotation.
071   private final ObjectSwap swap;                              // ObjectSwap defined only via @Beanp annotation.
072
073   private final BeanRegistry beanRegistry;
074
075   private final Object overrideValue;                       // The bean property value (if it's an overridden delegate).
076   private final BeanPropertyMeta delegateFor;               // The bean property that this meta is a delegate for.
077   private final boolean canRead, canWrite, readOnly, writeOnly;
078   private final int hashCode;
079
080   /**
081    * Creates a builder for {@link #BeanPropertyMeta} objects.
082    *
083    * @param beanMeta The metadata on the bean
084    * @param name The bean property name.
085    * @return A new builder.
086    */
087   public static Builder builder(BeanMeta<?> beanMeta, String name) {
088      return new Builder(beanMeta, name);
089   }
090
091   /**
092    * BeanPropertyMeta builder class.
093    */
094   public static class Builder {
095      BeanMeta<?> beanMeta;
096      BeanContext beanContext;
097      String name;
098      Field field, innerField;
099      Method getter, setter, extraKeys;
100      boolean isConstructorArg, isUri, isDyna, isDynaGetterMap;
101      ClassMeta<?> rawTypeMeta, typeMeta;
102      String[] properties;
103      ObjectSwap swap;
104      BeanRegistry beanRegistry;
105      Object overrideValue;
106      BeanPropertyMeta delegateFor;
107      boolean canRead, canWrite, readOnly, writeOnly;
108
109      Builder(BeanMeta<?> beanMeta, String name) {
110         this.beanMeta = beanMeta;
111         this.beanContext = beanMeta.ctx;
112         this.name = name;
113      }
114
115      /**
116       * Sets the raw metadata type for this bean property.
117       *
118       * @param rawMetaType The raw metadata type for this bean property.
119       * @return This object.
120       */
121      public Builder rawMetaType(ClassMeta<?> rawMetaType) {
122         this.rawTypeMeta = rawMetaType;
123         this.typeMeta = rawTypeMeta;
124         return this;
125      }
126
127      /**
128       * Sets the bean registry to use with this bean property.
129       *
130       * @param beanRegistry The bean registry to use with this bean property.
131       * @return This object.
132       */
133      public Builder beanRegistry(BeanRegistry beanRegistry) {
134         this.beanRegistry = beanRegistry;
135         return this;
136      }
137
138      /**
139       * Sets the overridden value of this bean property.
140       *
141       * @param overrideValue The overridden value of this bean property.
142       * @return This object.
143       */
144      public Builder overrideValue(Object overrideValue) {
145         this.overrideValue = overrideValue;
146         return this;
147      }
148
149      /**
150       * Sets the original bean property that this one is overriding.
151       *
152       * @param delegateFor The original bean property that this one is overriding.
153       * @return This object.
154       */
155      public Builder delegateFor(BeanPropertyMeta delegateFor) {
156         this.delegateFor = delegateFor;
157         return this;
158      }
159
160      Builder canRead() {
161         this.canRead = true;
162         return this;
163      }
164
165      Builder canWrite() {
166         this.canWrite = true;
167         return this;
168      }
169
170      boolean validate(BeanContext bc, BeanRegistry parentBeanRegistry, Map<Class<?>,Class<?>[]> typeVarImpls, Set<String> bpro, Set<String> bpwo) throws Exception {
171
172         List<Class<?>> bdClasses = list();
173
174         if (field == null && getter == null && setter == null)
175            return false;
176
177         if (field == null && setter == null && bc.isBeansRequireSettersForGetters() && ! isConstructorArg)
178            return false;
179
180         canRead |= (field != null || getter != null);
181         canWrite |= (field != null || setter != null);
182
183         if (innerField != null) {
184            List<Beanp> lp = list();
185            bc.forEachAnnotation(Beanp.class, innerField, x -> true, x -> lp.add(x));
186            if (field != null || Utils.isNotEmpty(lp)) {
187               // Only use field type if it's a bean property or has @Beanp annotation.
188               // Otherwise, we want to infer the type from the getter or setter.
189               rawTypeMeta = bc.resolveClassMeta(last(lp), innerField.getGenericType(), typeVarImpls);
190               isUri |= (rawTypeMeta.isUri());
191            }
192            lp.forEach(x -> {
193               if (! x.properties().isEmpty())
194                  properties = splita(x.properties());
195               addAll(bdClasses, x.dictionary());
196               if (! x.ro().isEmpty())
197                  readOnly = Boolean.valueOf(x.ro());
198               if (! x.wo().isEmpty())
199                  writeOnly = Boolean.valueOf(x.wo());
200            });
201            bc.forEachAnnotation(Swap.class, innerField, x -> true, x -> swap = getPropertySwap(x));
202            isUri |= bc.firstAnnotation(Uri.class, innerField, x->true) != null;
203         }
204
205         if (getter != null) {
206            List<Beanp> lp = list();
207            bc.forEachAnnotation(Beanp.class, getter, x -> true, x -> lp.add(x));
208            if (rawTypeMeta == null)
209               rawTypeMeta = bc.resolveClassMeta(last(lp), getter.getGenericReturnType(), typeVarImpls);
210            isUri |= (rawTypeMeta.isUri() || bc.hasAnnotation(Uri.class, getter));
211            lp.forEach(x -> {
212               if (properties != null && ! x.properties().isEmpty())
213                  properties = splita(x.properties());
214               addAll(bdClasses, x.dictionary());
215               if (! x.ro().isEmpty())
216                  readOnly = Boolean.valueOf(x.ro());
217               if (! x.wo().isEmpty())
218                  writeOnly = Boolean.valueOf(x.wo());
219            });
220            bc.forEachAnnotation(Swap.class, getter, x -> true, x -> swap = getPropertySwap(x));
221         }
222
223         if (setter != null) {
224            List<Beanp> lp = list ();
225            bc.forEachAnnotation(Beanp.class, setter, x -> true, x -> lp.add(x));
226            if (rawTypeMeta == null)
227               rawTypeMeta = bc.resolveClassMeta(last(lp), setter.getGenericParameterTypes()[0], typeVarImpls);
228            isUri |= (rawTypeMeta.isUri() || bc.hasAnnotation(Uri.class, setter));
229            lp.forEach(x -> {
230               if (swap == null)
231                  swap = getPropertySwap(x);
232               if (properties != null && ! x.properties().isEmpty())
233                  properties = splita(x.properties());
234               addAll(bdClasses, x.dictionary());
235               if (! x.ro().isEmpty())
236                  readOnly = Boolean.valueOf(x.ro());
237               if (! x.wo().isEmpty())
238                  writeOnly = Boolean.valueOf(x.wo());
239            });
240            bc.forEachAnnotation(Swap.class, setter, x -> true, x -> swap = getPropertySwap(x));
241         }
242
243         if (rawTypeMeta == null)
244            return false;
245
246         this.beanRegistry = new BeanRegistry(beanContext, parentBeanRegistry, bdClasses.toArray(new Class<?>[0]));
247
248         isDyna = "*".equals(name);
249
250         // Do some annotation validation.
251         ClassInfo ci = rawTypeMeta.getInfo();
252         if (getter != null) {
253            Class<?>[] pt = getter.getParameterTypes();
254            if (isDyna) {
255               if (ci.isChildOf(Map.class) && pt.length == 0) {
256                  isDynaGetterMap = true;
257               } else if (pt.length == 1 && pt[0] == String.class) {
258                  // OK.
259               } else {
260                  return false;
261               }
262            } else {
263               if (! ci.isChildOf(getter.getReturnType()))
264                  return false;
265            }
266         }
267         if (setter != null) {
268            Class<?>[] pt = setter.getParameterTypes();
269            if (isDyna) {
270               if (pt.length == 2 && pt[0] == String.class) {
271                  // OK.
272               } else {
273                  return false;
274               }
275            } else {
276               if (pt.length != 1 || ! ci.isChildOf(pt[0]))
277                  return false;
278            }
279         }
280         if (field != null) {
281            if (isDyna) {
282               if (! ClassInfo.of(field.getType()).isChildOf(Map.class))
283                  return false;
284            } else {
285               if (! ci.isChildOf(field.getType()))
286                  return false;
287            }
288         }
289
290         if (isDyna) {
291            rawTypeMeta = rawTypeMeta.getValueType();
292            if (rawTypeMeta == null)
293               rawTypeMeta = beanContext.object();
294         }
295         if (rawTypeMeta == null)
296            return false;
297
298         if (typeMeta == null)
299            typeMeta = (swap != null ? beanContext.getClassMeta(swap.getSwapClass().innerType()) : rawTypeMeta == null ? beanContext.object() : rawTypeMeta);
300         if (typeMeta == null)
301            typeMeta = rawTypeMeta;
302
303         if (bpro.contains(name) || bpro.contains("*"))
304            readOnly = true;
305         if (bpwo.contains(name) || bpwo.contains("*"))
306            writeOnly = true;
307
308         return true;
309      }
310
311      /**
312       * @return A new BeanPropertyMeta object using this builder.
313       */
314      public BeanPropertyMeta build() {
315         return new BeanPropertyMeta(this);
316      }
317
318      private ObjectSwap getPropertySwap(Beanp p) {
319         if (! p.format().isEmpty())
320            return BeanCreator.of(ObjectSwap.class).type(StringFormatSwap.class).arg(String.class, p.format()).run();
321         return null;
322      }
323
324      private ObjectSwap getPropertySwap(Swap s) throws RuntimeException {
325         Class<?> c = s.value();
326         if (isVoid(c))
327            c = s.impl();
328         if (isVoid(c))
329            return null;
330         ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
331         if (ci.isChildOf(ObjectSwap.class)) {
332            ObjectSwap ps = BeanCreator.of(ObjectSwap.class).type(c).run();
333            if (ps.forMediaTypes() != null)
334               throw new UnsupportedOperationException("TODO - Media types on swaps not yet supported on bean properties.");
335            if (ps.withTemplate() != null)
336               throw new UnsupportedOperationException("TODO - Templates on swaps not yet supported on bean properties.");
337            return ps;
338         }
339         if (ci.isChildOf(Surrogate.class))
340            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("TODO - Surrogate swaps not yet supported on bean properties.");
341         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid class used in @Swap annotation.  Must be a subclass of ObjectSwap or Surrogate. {0}", c);
342      }
343
344      BeanPropertyMeta.Builder setGetter(Method getter) {
345         setAccessible(getter);
346         this.getter = getter;
347         return this;
348      }
349
350      BeanPropertyMeta.Builder setSetter(Method setter) {
351         setAccessible(setter);
352         this.setter = setter;
353         return this;
354      }
355
356      BeanPropertyMeta.Builder setField(Field field) {
357         setAccessible(field);
358         this.field = field;
359         this.innerField = field;
360         return this;
361      }
362
363      BeanPropertyMeta.Builder setInnerField(Field innerField) {
364         this.innerField = innerField;
365         return this;
366      }
367
368      BeanPropertyMeta.Builder setExtraKeys(Method extraKeys) {
369         setAccessible(extraKeys);
370         this.extraKeys = extraKeys;
371         return this;
372      }
373
374      BeanPropertyMeta.Builder setAsConstructorArg() {
375         this.isConstructorArg = true;
376         return this;
377      }
378
379   }
380
381   /**
382    * Creates a new BeanPropertyMeta using the contents of the specified builder.
383    *
384    * @param b The builder to copy fields from.
385    */
386   protected BeanPropertyMeta(BeanPropertyMeta.Builder b) {
387      this.field = b.field;
388      this.innerField = b.innerField;
389      this.getter = b.getter;
390      this.setter = b.setter;
391      this.extraKeys = b.extraKeys;
392      this.isUri = b.isUri;
393      this.beanMeta = b.beanMeta;
394      this.beanContext = b.beanContext;
395      this.name = b.name;
396      this.rawTypeMeta = b.rawTypeMeta;
397      this.typeMeta = b.typeMeta;
398      this.properties = b.properties;
399      this.swap = b.swap;
400      this.beanRegistry = b.beanRegistry;
401      this.overrideValue = b.overrideValue;
402      this.delegateFor = b.delegateFor;
403      this.isDyna = b.isDyna;
404      this.isDynaGetterMap = b.isDynaGetterMap;
405      this.canRead = b.canRead;
406      this.canWrite = b.canWrite;
407      this.readOnly = b.readOnly;
408      this.writeOnly = b.writeOnly;
409      this.hashCode = HashCode.of(beanMeta,name);
410   }
411
412   /**
413    * Returns the name of this bean property.
414    *
415    * @return The name of the bean property.
416    */
417   public String getName() {
418      return name;
419   }
420
421   /**
422    * Returns the bean meta that this property belongs to.
423    *
424    * @return The bean meta that this property belongs to.
425    */
426   public BeanMeta<?> getBeanMeta() {
427      return beanMeta;
428   }
429
430   /**
431    * Returns the getter method for this property.
432    *
433    * @return The getter method for this bean property, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no getter method.
434    */
435   public Method getGetter() {
436      return getter;
437   }
438
439   /**
440    * Returns the setter method for this property.
441    *
442    * @return The setter method for this bean property, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no setter method.
443    */
444   public Method getSetter() {
445      return setter;
446   }
447
448   /**
449    * Returns the field for this property.
450    *
451    * @return The field for this bean property, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no field associated with this bean property.
452    */
453   public Field getField() {
454      return field;
455   }
456
457   /**
458    * Returns the field for this property even if the field is private.
459    *
460    * @return The field for this bean property, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no field associated with this bean property.
461    */
462   public Field getInnerField() {
463      return innerField;
464   }
465
466   /**
467    * Returns the {@link ClassMeta} of the class of this property.
468    *
469    * <p>
470    * If this property or the property type class has a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it, this method returns the
471    * transformed class meta.
472    * This matches the class type that is used by the {@link #get(BeanMap,String)} and
473    * {@link #set(BeanMap,String,Object)} methods.
474    *
475    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} of the class of this property.
476    */
477   public ClassMeta<?> getClassMeta() {
478      return typeMeta;
479   }
480
481   /**
482    * Returns the bean dictionary in use for this bean property.
483    *
484    * <p>
485    * The order of lookup for the dictionary is as follows:
486    * <ol>
487    *    <li>Dictionary defined via {@link Beanp#dictionary() @Beanp(dictionary)}.
488    *    <li>Dictionary defined via {@link BeanContext.Builder#beanDictionary(Class...)}.
489    * </ol>
490    *
491    * @return The bean dictionary in use for this bean property.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
492    */
493   public BeanRegistry getBeanRegistry() {
494      return beanRegistry;
495   }
496
497   /**
498    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this bean property is a URI.
499    *
500    * <p>
501    * A bean property can be considered a URI if any of the following are true:
502    * <ul>
503    *    <li>Property class type is {@link URL} or {@link URI}.
504    *    <li>Property class type is annotated with {@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.Uri @Uri}.
505    *    <li>Property getter, setter, or field is annotated with {@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.Uri @Uri}.
506    * </ul>
507    *
508    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this bean property is a URI.
509    */
510   public boolean isUri() {
511      return isUri;
512   }
513
514   /**
515    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this bean property is named <js>"*"</js>.
516    *
517    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this bean property is named <js>"*"</js>.
518    */
519   public boolean isDyna() {
520      return isDyna;
521   }
522
523   /**
524    * Returns the override list of properties defined through a {@link Beanp#properties() @Beanp(properties)} annotation
525    * on this property.
526    *
527    * @return The list of override properties, or <jk>null</jk> if annotation not specified.
528    */
529   public String[] getProperties() {
530      return properties;
531   }
532
533   /**
534    * Returns the metadata on the property that this metadata is a delegate for.
535    *
536    * @return the metadata on the property that this metadata is a delegate for, or this object if it's not a delegate.
537    */
538   public BeanPropertyMeta getDelegateFor() {
539      return delegateFor != null ? delegateFor : this;
540   }
541
542   /**
543    * Equivalent to calling {@link BeanMap#get(Object)}, but is faster since it avoids looking up the property meta.
544    *
545    * @param m The bean map to get the transformed value from.
546    * @param pName
547    *    The property name if this is a dyna property (i.e. <js>"*"</js>).
548    *    <br>Otherwise can be <jk>null</jk>.
549    * @return
550    *    The property value.
551    *    <br>Returns <jk>null</jk> if this is a write-only property.
552    */
553   public Object get(BeanMap<?> m, String pName) {
554      return m.meta.onReadProperty(m.bean, pName, getInner(m, pName));
555   }
556
557   private Object getInner(BeanMap<?> m, String pName) {
558      try {
559
560         if (writeOnly)
561            return null;
562
563         if (overrideValue != null)
564            return overrideValue;
565
566         // Read-only beans have their properties stored in a cache until getBean() is called.
567         Object bean = m.bean;
568         if (bean == null)
569            return m.propertyCache.get(name);
570
571         return toSerializedForm(m.getBeanSession(), getRaw(m, pName));
572
573      } catch (Throwable e) {
574         if (beanContext.isIgnoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters()) {
575            if (rawTypeMeta.isPrimitive())
576               return rawTypeMeta.getPrimitiveDefault();
577            return null;
578         }
579         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, beanMeta.c, "Exception occurred while getting property ''{0}''", name);
580      }
581   }
582
583   /**
584    * Equivalent to calling {@link BeanMap#getRaw(Object)}, but is faster since it avoids looking up the property meta.
585    *
586    * @param m The bean map to get the transformed value from.
587    * @param pName
588    *    The property name if this is a dyna property (i.e. <js>"*"</js>).
589    *    <br>Otherwise can be <jk>null</jk>.
590    * @return The raw property value.
591    */
592   public Object getRaw(BeanMap<?> m, String pName) {
593      try {
594         // Read-only beans have their properties stored in a cache until getBean() is called.
595         Object bean = m.bean;
596         if (bean == null)
597            return m.propertyCache.get(name);
598
599         return invokeGetter(bean, pName);
600
601      } catch (Throwable e) {
602         if (beanContext.isIgnoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters()) {
603            if (rawTypeMeta.isPrimitive())
604               return rawTypeMeta.getPrimitiveDefault();
605            return null;
606         }
607         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, beanMeta.c, "Exception occurred while getting property ''{0}''", name);
608      }
609   }
610
611   /**
612    * Converts a raw bean property value to serialized form.
613    * Applies transforms and child property filters.
614    */
615   Object toSerializedForm(BeanSession session, Object o) {
616      try {
617         o = transform(session, o);
618         if (o == null)
619            return null;
620         if (properties != null) {
621            if (rawTypeMeta.isArray()) {
622               Object[] a = (Object[])o;
623               List l = new DelegateList(rawTypeMeta);
624               ClassMeta childType = rawTypeMeta.getElementType();
625               for (Object c : a)
626                  l.add(applyChildPropertiesFilter(session, childType, c));
627               return l;
628            } else if (rawTypeMeta.isCollection()) {
629               Collection c = (Collection)o;
630               List l = Utils.listOfSize(c.size());
631               ClassMeta childType = rawTypeMeta.getElementType();
632               c.forEach(x -> l.add(applyChildPropertiesFilter(session, childType, x)));
633               return l;
634            } else {
635               return applyChildPropertiesFilter(session, rawTypeMeta, o);
636            }
637         }
638         return o;
639      } catch (SerializeException e) {
640         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
641      }
642   }
643
644   /**
645    * Equivalent to calling {@link BeanMap#put(String, Object)}, but is faster since it avoids looking up the property
646    * meta.
647    *
648    * <p>
649    * This is a no-op on a read-only property.
650    *
651    * @param m The bean map to set the property value on.
652    * @param pName
653    *    The property name if this is a dyna property (i.e. <js>"*"</js>).
654    *    <br>Otherwise can be <jk>null</jk>.
655    * @param value The value to set.
656    * @return The previous property value.
657    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If property could not be set.
658    */
659   public Object set(BeanMap<?> m, String pName, Object value) throws BeanRuntimeException {
660      return setInner(m, pName, m.meta.onWriteProperty(m.bean, pName, value));
661   }
662
663   private Object setInner(BeanMap<?> m, String pName, Object value) throws BeanRuntimeException {
664      try {
665
666         if (readOnly)
667            return null;
668
669         BeanSession session = m.getBeanSession();
670
671         // Convert to raw form.
672         value = unswap(session, value);
673
674         if (m.bean == null) {
675
676            // Read-only beans get their properties stored in a cache.
677            if (m.propertyCache != null)
678               return m.propertyCache.put(name, value);
679
680            throw new BeanRuntimeException("Non-existent bean instance on bean.");
681         }
682
683         boolean isMap = rawTypeMeta.isMap();
684         boolean isCollection = rawTypeMeta.isCollection();
685
686         if ((! isDyna) && field == null && setter == null && ! (isMap || isCollection)) {
687            if ((value == null && beanContext.isIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties()) || beanContext.isIgnoreMissingSetters())
688               return null;
689            throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Setter or public field not defined on property ''{0}''", name);
690         }
691
692         Object bean = m.getBean(true);  // Don't use getBean() because it triggers array creation!
693
694         try {
695
696            Object r = (beanContext.isBeanMapPutReturnsOldValue() || isMap || isCollection) && (getter != null || field != null) ? get(m, pName) : null;
697            Class<?> propertyClass = rawTypeMeta.getInnerClass();
698            ClassInfo pcInfo = rawTypeMeta.getInfo();
699
700            if (value == null && (isMap || isCollection)) {
701               invokeSetter(bean, pName, null);
702               return r;
703            }
704
705            Class<?> vc = value == null ? null : value.getClass();
706
707            if (isMap && (setter == null || ! pcInfo.isParentOf(vc))) {
708
709               if (! (value instanceof Map)) {
710                  if (value instanceof CharSequence)
711                     value = JsonMap.ofJson((CharSequence)value).session(session);
712                  else
713                     throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' to object of type ''{2}''", name, propertyClass.getName(), findClassName(value));
714               }
715
716               Map valueMap = (Map)value;
717               Map propMap = (Map)r;
718               ClassMeta<?> valueType = rawTypeMeta.getValueType();
719
720               // If the property type is abstract, then we either need to reuse the existing
721               // map (if it's not null), or try to assign the value directly.
722               if (! rawTypeMeta.canCreateNewInstance()) {
723                  if (propMap == null) {
724                     if (setter == null && field == null)
725                        throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' to object of type ''{2}'' because no setter or public field is defined, and the current value is null", name, propertyClass.getName(), findClassName(value));
726
727                     if (propertyClass.isInstance(valueMap)) {
728                        if (! valueType.isObject()) {
729                           Flag needsConversion = Flag.create();
730                           valueMap.forEach((k,v) -> {
731                              if (v != null && ! valueType.getInnerClass().isInstance(v)) {
732                                 needsConversion.set();
733                              }
734                           });
735                           if (needsConversion.isSet())
736                              valueMap = (Map)session.convertToType(valueMap, rawTypeMeta);
737                        }
738                        invokeSetter(bean, pName, valueMap);
739                        return r;
740                     }
741                     throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{2}'' to object of type ''{2}'' because the assigned map cannot be converted to the specified type because the property type is abstract, and the property value is currently null", name, propertyClass.getName(), findClassName(value));
742                  }
743               } else {
744                  if (propMap == null) {
745                     propMap = BeanCreator.of(Map.class).type(propertyClass).run();
746                  } else {
747                     propMap.clear();
748                  }
749               }
750
751               // Set the values.
752               Map propMap2 = propMap;
753               valueMap.forEach((k,v) -> {
754                  if (! valueType.isObject())
755                     v = session.convertToType(v, valueType);
756                  propMap2.put(k, v);
757               });
758               if (setter != null || field != null)
759                  invokeSetter(bean, pName, propMap);
760
761            } else if (isCollection && (setter == null || ! pcInfo.isParentOf(vc))) {
762
763               if (! (value instanceof Collection)) {
764                  if (value instanceof CharSequence)
765                     value = new JsonList((CharSequence)value).setBeanSession(session);
766                  else
767                     throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' to object of type ''{2}''", name, propertyClass.getName(), findClassName(value));
768               }
769
770               Collection valueList = (Collection)value;
771               Collection propList = (Collection)r;
772               ClassMeta elementType = rawTypeMeta.getElementType();
773
774               // If the property type is abstract, then we either need to reuse the existing
775               // collection (if it's not null), or try to assign the value directly.
776               if (! rawTypeMeta.canCreateNewInstance()) {
777                  if (propList == null) {
778                     if (setter == null && field == null)
779                        throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' to object of type ''{2}'' because no setter or public field is defined, and the current value is null", name, propertyClass.getName(), findClassName(value));
780
781                     if (propertyClass.isInstance(valueList) || (setter != null && setter.getParameterTypes()[0] == Collection.class)) {
782                        if (! elementType.isObject()) {
783                              List l = new JsonList(valueList);
784                              for (ListIterator<Object> i = l.listIterator(); i.hasNext(); ) {
785                                 Object v = i.next();
786                                 if (v != null && (! elementType.getInnerClass().isInstance(v))) {
787                                    i.set(session.convertToType(v, elementType));
788                                 }
789                              }
790                              valueList = l;
791                           }
792                        invokeSetter(bean, pName, valueList);
793                        return r;
794                     }
795                     throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' to object of type ''{2}'' because the assigned map cannot be converted to the specified type because the property type is abstract, and the property value is currently null", name, propertyClass.getName(), findClassName(value));
796                  }
797                  propList.clear();
798               } else {
799                  if (propList == null) {
800                     propList = BeanCreator.of(Collection.class).type(propertyClass).run();
801                     invokeSetter(bean, pName, propList);
802                  } else {
803                     propList.clear();
804                  }
805               }
806
807               // Set the values.
808               Collection propList2 = propList;
809               valueList.forEach(x -> {
810                  if (! elementType.isObject())
811                     x = session.convertToType(x, elementType);
812                  propList2.add(x);
813               });
814
815            } else {
816               if (swap != null && value != null && swap.getSwapClass().isParentOf(value.getClass())) {
817                  value = swap.unswap(session, value, rawTypeMeta);
818               } else {
819                  value = session.convertToType(value, rawTypeMeta);
820               }
821               invokeSetter(bean, pName, value);
822            }
823
824            return r;
825
826         } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
827            throw e;
828         } catch (Exception e) {
829            if (beanContext.isIgnoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters()) {
830                  if (rawTypeMeta.isPrimitive())
831                     return rawTypeMeta.getPrimitiveDefault();
832               return null;
833            }
834            throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, beanMeta.c, "Error occurred trying to set property ''{0}''", name);
835         }
836      } catch (ParseException e) {
837         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
838      }
839   }
840
841   private Object invokeGetter(Object bean, String pName) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException {
842      if (isDyna) {
843         Map m = null;
844         if (getter != null) {
845            if (! isDynaGetterMap)
846               return getter.invoke(bean, pName);
847            m = (Map)getter.invoke(bean);
848         }
849         else if (field != null)
850            m = (Map)field.get(bean);
851         else
852            throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Getter or public field not defined on property ''{0}''", name);
853         return (m == null ? null : m.get(pName));
854      }
855      if (getter != null)
856         return getter.invoke(bean);
857      if (field != null)
858         return field.get(bean);
859      throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Getter or public field not defined on property ''{0}''", name);
860   }
861
862   private Object invokeSetter(Object bean, String pName, Object val) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException {
863      if (isDyna) {
864         if (setter != null)
865            return setter.invoke(bean, pName, val);
866         Map m = null;
867         if (field != null)
868            m = (Map<String,Object>)field.get(bean);
869         else if (getter != null)
870            m = (Map<String,Object>)getter.invoke(bean);
871         else
872            throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' to object of type ''{2}'' because no setter is defined on this property, and the existing property value is null", name, this.getClassMeta().getInnerClass().getName(), findClassName(val));
873         return (m == null ? null : m.put(pName, val));
874      }
875      if (setter != null)
876         return setter.invoke(bean, val);
877      if (field != null) {
878         field.set(bean, val);
879         return null;
880      }
881      throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Cannot set property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' to object of type ''{2}'' because no setter is defined on this property, and the existing property value is null", name, this.getClassMeta().getInnerClass().getName(), findClassName(val));
882   }
883
884   /**
885    * Returns the {@link Map} object returned by the DynaBean getter.
886    *
887    * <p>
888    * The DynaBean property is the property whose name is <js>"*"</js> and returns a map of "extra" properties on the
889    * bean.
890    *
891    * @param bean The bean.
892    * @return
893    *    The map returned by the getter, or an empty map if the getter returned <jk>null</jk> or this isn't a DynaBean
894    *    property.
895    * @throws IllegalArgumentException Thrown by method invocation.
896    * @throws IllegalAccessException Thrown by method invocation.
897    * @throws InvocationTargetException Thrown by method invocation.
898    */
899   public Map<String,Object> getDynaMap(Object bean) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException {
900      if (isDyna) {
901         if (extraKeys != null && getter != null && ! isDynaGetterMap) {
902            Map<String,Object> m = map();
903            ((Collection<String>)extraKeys.invoke(bean)).forEach(x -> safe(()->m.put(x, getter.invoke(bean, x))));
904            return m;
905         }
906         if (getter != null && isDynaGetterMap)
907            return (Map)getter.invoke(bean);
908         if (field != null)
909            return (Map)field.get(bean);
910         throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Getter or public field not defined on property ''{0}''", name);
911      }
912      return Collections.EMPTY_MAP;
913   }
914
915   /**
916    * Sets an array field on this bean.
917    *
918    * <p>
919    * Works on both <c>Object</c> and primitive arrays.
920    *
921    * @param bean The bean of the field.
922    * @param l The collection to use to set the array field.
923    * @throws IllegalArgumentException Thrown by method invocation.
924    * @throws IllegalAccessException Thrown by method invocation.
925    * @throws InvocationTargetException Thrown by method invocation.
926    */
927   protected void setArray(Object bean, List l) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException {
928      Object array = toArray(l, this.rawTypeMeta.getElementType().getInnerClass());
929      invokeSetter(bean, name, array);
930   }
931
932   /**
933    * Adds a value to a {@link Collection} or array property.
934    *
935    * <p>
936    * Note that adding values to an array property is inefficient for large arrays since it must copy the array into a
937    * larger array on each operation.
938    *
939    * @param m The bean of the field being set.
940    * @param pName
941    *    The property name if this is a dyna property (i.e. <js>"*"</js>).
942    *    <br>Otherwise can be <jk>null</jk>.
943    * @param value The value to add to the field.
944    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If field is not a collection or array.
945    */
946   public void add(BeanMap<?> m, String pName, Object value) throws BeanRuntimeException {
947
948      // Read-only beans get their properties stored in a cache.
949      if (m.bean == null) {
950         if (! m.propertyCache.containsKey(name))
951            m.propertyCache.put(name, new JsonList(m.getBeanSession()));
952         ((JsonList)m.propertyCache.get(name)).add(value);
953         return;
954      }
955
956      BeanSession session = m.getBeanSession();
957
958      boolean isCollection = rawTypeMeta.isCollection();
959      boolean isArray = rawTypeMeta.isArray();
960
961      if (! (isCollection || isArray))
962         throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Attempt to add element to property ''{0}'' which is not a collection or array", name);
963
964      Object bean = m.getBean(true);
965
966      ClassMeta<?> elementType = rawTypeMeta.getElementType();
967
968      try {
969         Object v = session.convertToType(value, elementType);
970
971         if (isCollection) {
972            Collection c = (Collection)invokeGetter(bean, pName);
973
974            if (c != null) {
975               c.add(v);
976               return;
977            }
978
979            if (rawTypeMeta.canCreateNewInstance())
980               c = (Collection)rawTypeMeta.newInstance();
981            else
982               c = new JsonList(session);
983
984            c.add(v);
985
986            invokeSetter(bean, pName, c);
987
988         } else /* isArray() */ {
989
990            if (m.arrayPropertyCache == null)
991               m.arrayPropertyCache = new TreeMap<>();
992
993            List l = m.arrayPropertyCache.get(name);
994            if (l == null) {
995               l = new LinkedList();  // ArrayLists and LinkLists appear to perform equally.
996               m.arrayPropertyCache.put(name, l);
997
998               // Copy any existing array values into the temporary list.
999               Object oldArray = invokeGetter(bean, pName);
1000               copyToList(oldArray, l);
1001            }
1002
1003            // Add new entry to our array.
1004            l.add(v);
1005         }
1006
1007      } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
1008         throw e;
1009      } catch (Exception e) {
1010         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
1011      }
1012   }
1013
1014   /**
1015    * Adds a value to a {@link Map} or bean property.
1016    *
1017    * @param m The bean of the field being set.
1018    * @param pName
1019    *    The property name if this is a dyna property (i.e. <js>"*"</js>).
1020    *    <br>Otherwise can be <jk>null</jk>.
1021    * @param key The key to add to the field.
1022    * @param value The value to add to the field.
1023    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If field is not a map or array.
1024    */
1025   public void add(BeanMap<?> m, String pName, String key, Object value) throws BeanRuntimeException {
1026
1027      // Read-only beans get their properties stored in a cache.
1028      if (m.bean == null) {
1029         if (! m.propertyCache.containsKey(name))
1030            m.propertyCache.put(name, new JsonMap(m.getBeanSession()));
1031         ((JsonMap)m.propertyCache.get(name)).append(key.toString(), value);
1032         return;
1033      }
1034
1035      BeanSession session = m.getBeanSession();
1036
1037      boolean isMap = rawTypeMeta.isMap();
1038      boolean isBean = rawTypeMeta.isBean();
1039
1040      if (! (isBean || isMap))
1041         throw new BeanRuntimeException(beanMeta.c, "Attempt to add key/value to property ''{0}'' which is not a map or bean", name);
1042
1043      Object bean = m.getBean(true);
1044
1045      ClassMeta<?> elementType = rawTypeMeta.getElementType();
1046
1047      try {
1048         Object v = session.convertToType(value, elementType);
1049
1050         if (isMap) {
1051            Map map = (Map)invokeGetter(bean, pName);
1052
1053            if (map != null) {
1054               map.put(key, v);
1055               return;
1056            }
1057
1058            if (rawTypeMeta.canCreateNewInstance())
1059               map = (Map)rawTypeMeta.newInstance();
1060            else
1061               map = new JsonMap(session);
1062
1063            map.put(key, v);
1064
1065            invokeSetter(bean, pName, map);
1066
1067         } else /* isBean() */ {
1068
1069            Object b = invokeGetter(bean, pName);
1070
1071            if (b != null) {
1072               BeanMap bm = session.toBeanMap(b);
1073               bm.put(key, v);
1074               return;
1075            }
1076
1077            if (rawTypeMeta.canCreateNewInstance(m.getBean(false))) {
1078               b = rawTypeMeta.newInstance();
1079               BeanMap bm = session.toBeanMap(b);
1080               bm.put(key, v);
1081            }
1082
1083            invokeSetter(bean, pName, b);
1084         }
1085
1086      } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
1087         throw e;
1088      } catch (Exception e) {
1089         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
1090      }
1091   }
1092
1093   /**
1094    * Returns all instances of the specified annotation in the hierarchy of this bean property.
1095    *
1096    * <p>
1097    * Searches through the class hierarchy (e.g. superclasses, interfaces, packages) for all instances of the
1098    * specified annotation.
1099    *
1100    * @param <A> The class to find annotations for.
1101    * @param a The class to find annotations for.
1102    * @return A list of annotations ordered in parent-to-child order.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1103    */
1104   public <A extends Annotation> List<A> getAllAnnotationsParentFirst(Class<A> a) {
1105      List<A> l = new LinkedList<>();
1106      BeanContext bc = beanContext;
1107      if (a == null)
1108         return l;
1109      getBeanMeta().getClassMeta().getInfo().forEachAnnotation(bc, a, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1110      if (field != null) {
1111         bc.forEachAnnotation(a, field, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1112         ClassInfo.of(field.getType()).forEachAnnotation(bc, a, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1113      }
1114      if (getter != null) {
1115         bc.forEachAnnotation(a, getter, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1116         ClassInfo.of(getter.getReturnType()).forEachAnnotation(bc, a, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1117      }
1118      if (setter != null) {
1119         bc.forEachAnnotation(a, setter, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1120         ClassInfo.of(setter.getReturnType()).forEachAnnotation(bc, a, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1121      }
1122      if (extraKeys != null) {
1123         bc.forEachAnnotation(a, extraKeys, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1124         ClassInfo.of(extraKeys.getReturnType()).forEachAnnotation(bc, a, x -> true, x -> l.add(x));
1125      }
1126
1127      return l;
1128   }
1129
1130   /**
1131    * Performs an action on all matching instances of the specified annotation on the getter/setter/field of the property.
1132    *
1133    * @param <A> The class to find annotations for.
1134    * @param a The class to find annotations for.
1135    * @param filter The filter to apply to the annotation.
1136    * @param action The action to perform against the annotation.
1137    * @return A list of annotations ordered in child-to-parent order.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1138    */
1139   public <A extends Annotation> BeanPropertyMeta forEachAnnotation(Class<A> a, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
1140      BeanContext bc = beanContext;
1141      if (a != null) {
1142         bc.forEachAnnotation(a, field, filter, action);
1143         bc.forEachAnnotation(a, getter, filter, action);
1144         bc.forEachAnnotation(a, setter, filter, action);
1145      }
1146      return this;
1147   }
1148
1149   private Object transform(BeanSession session, Object o) throws SerializeException {
1150      try {
1151         // First use swap defined via @Beanp.
1152         if (swap != null)
1153            return swap.swap(session, o);
1154         if (o == null)
1155            return null;
1156         // Otherwise, look it up via bean context.
1157         if (rawTypeMeta.hasChildSwaps()) {
1158            ObjectSwap f = rawTypeMeta.getChildObjectSwapForSwap(o.getClass());
1159            if (f != null)
1160               return f.swap(session, o);
1161         }
1162         return o;
1163      } catch (SerializeException e) {
1164         throw e;
1165      } catch (Exception e) {
1166         throw new SerializeException(e);
1167      }
1168   }
1169
1170   private Object unswap(BeanSession session, Object o) throws ParseException {
1171      try {
1172         if (swap != null)
1173            return swap.unswap(session, o, rawTypeMeta);
1174         if (o == null)
1175            return null;
1176         if (rawTypeMeta.hasChildSwaps()) {
1177            ObjectSwap f = rawTypeMeta.getChildObjectSwapForUnswap(o.getClass());
1178            if (f != null)
1179               return f.unswap(session, o, rawTypeMeta);
1180         }
1181         return o;
1182      } catch (ParseException e) {
1183         throw e;
1184      } catch (Exception e) {
1185         throw new ParseException(e);
1186      }
1187   }
1188
1189   private Object applyChildPropertiesFilter(BeanSession session, ClassMeta cm, Object o) {
1190      if (o == null)
1191         return null;
1192      if (cm.isBean())
1193         return new BeanMap(session, o, new BeanMetaFiltered(cm.getBeanMeta(), properties));
1194      if (cm.isMap())
1195         return new FilteredMap(cm, (Map)o, properties);
1196      if (cm.isObject()) {
1197         if (o instanceof Map)
1198            return new FilteredMap(cm, (Map)o, properties);
1199         BeanMeta bm = beanContext.getBeanMeta(o.getClass());
1200         if (bm != null)
1201            return new BeanMap(session, o, new BeanMetaFiltered(cm.getBeanMeta(), properties));
1202      }
1203      return o;
1204   }
1205
1206   private static String findClassName(Object o) {
1207      if (o == null)
1208         return null;
1209      if (o instanceof Class)
1210         return ((Class<?>)o).getName();
1211      return o.getClass().getName();
1212   }
1213
1214   @Override /* Object */
1215   public String toString() {
1216      return name + ": " + this.rawTypeMeta.getInnerClass().getName() + ", field=["+field+"], getter=["+getter+"], setter=["+setter+"]";
1217   }

1219   /**
1220    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this property can be read.
1221    *
1222    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this property can be read.
1223    */
1224   public boolean canRead() {
1225      return canRead;
1226   }
1227
1228   /**
1229    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this property can be written.
1230    *
1231    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this property can be written.
1232    */
1233   public boolean canWrite() {
1234      return canWrite;
1235   }
1236
1237   /**
1238    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this property is read-only.
1239    *
1240    * <p>
1241    * This implies the property MIGHT be writable, but that parsers should not set a value for it.
1242    *
1243    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this property is read-only.
1244    */
1245   public boolean isReadOnly() {
1246      return readOnly;
1247   }
1248
1249   /**
1250    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this property is write-only.
1251    *
1252    * <p>
1253    * This implies the property MIGHT be readable, but that serializers should not serialize it.
1254    *
1255    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this property is write-only.
1256    */
1257   protected boolean isWriteOnly() {
1258      return writeOnly;
1259   }
1260
1261   @Override /* Comparable */
1262   public int compareTo(BeanPropertyMeta o) {
1263      return name.compareTo(o.name);
1264   }
1265
1266   @Override /* Object */
1267   public int hashCode() {
1268      return hashCode;
1269   }
1270
1271   @Override /* Object */
1272   public boolean equals(Object o) {
1273      return (o instanceof BeanPropertyMeta) && Utils.eq(this, (BeanPropertyMeta)o, (x,y)->Utils.eq(x.name, y.name) && Utils.eq(x.beanMeta, y.beanMeta));
1274   }
1275}
